headline: Wix Stock Down 70% in One Year, and This $7 Million Investor Called It Quits
summary: Wix.com offers cloud-based website creation and business management tools, generating recurring revenue from a global subscription base.

headline: Samsara, Nutanix, Workday, AppLovin, and Domo Shares Skyrocket, What You Need To Know
summary: A number of stocks jumped in the afternoon session after Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang dismissed fears that artificial intelligence would cannibalize the enterprise software sector.

headline: AppLovin Faces SEC Scrutiny While Preparing New Social Platform Launch
summary: AppLovin (NasdaqGS:APP) is under active SEC investigation into its data collection practices following a whistleblower complaint and short seller reports. At the same time, the company is preparing to launch a new social platform that aims to compete with large incumbents such as Meta, TikTok, and Snap. These developments come as AppLovin shares trade at $421.63, with a value score of 4 and a very large 3 year return. For investors watching AppLovin, the combination of regulatory scrutiny...

headline: Jim Cramer on Take-Two Interactive: “What a Buy That Is”
summary: Take-Two Interactive Software, Inc. (NASDAQ:TTWO) is one of the stocks that was on Jim Cramer’s radar recently. Cramer showed bullish sentiment toward the stock despite the release of Google’s Project Genie, as he commented: Before the show got preempted by the Olympics for two weeks, we were already witnessing a nasty sell-off in any industry […]

headline: Tradeable bounce is developing in software stocks, Raymond James says
summary: Investing.com -- Raymond James told clients in a note Thursday that software shares appear to be finding their footing after a steep two-month selloff, with the S&P 500 Software Industry Index attempting to stabilise near “major technical support.”

raw.headline: Tradeable bounce is developing in software stocks, Raymond James says

headline: Analysts Remain Bullish on AppLovin Corporation (APP) Despite Target Cuts
summary: AppLovin Corporation (NASDAQ:APP) is among the best stocks in each sector in 2026. On February 12, Omar Dessouky from BofA reduced the price target on AppLovin Corporation (NASDAQ:APP) to $705, down from $780, and maintained a Buy rating. This follows the company’s earnings call, after which the firm reduced its valuation due to de-rating in […]
